comments:
508

Use a Sun JDK 1.4 to run the IDE, so your default JRE is 1.4.
1. Import all of projects as binary.
2. Define a Sun 1.3.1 JDK as an additional runtime.
3. Set the Sun 1.3.1 JDK as the JRE to use for the Runtime-workbench.
In this configuration, I cannot get eclipse to launch.  Even without 
breakpoints, I suspend at an IllegalArgumentException.  I get multiple
"not responding" entries in the stack trace, and if I resume, I get the 
following in the console.

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Application not found: 
org.eclipse.ui.workbench
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:737)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:420)
	at EclipseRuntimeLauncher.main(EclipseRuntimeLauncher.java:16)
Exception in thread "main" 

If I set my default VM to match my runtime VM (1.3.1 or 1.4) - this is 
the standard behavior -I do not encounter this problem.

PDE simply uses IVMRunner selected in the launcher to run the instance. Note 
that you used JDK 1.4 to compile all your source in the workbench, but used 
1.3.1 to launch. Can this be a case of understandable lack of forward 
compatibility (cannot run 1.4 code with 1.3.1)? I don't know how to fix the 
this problem since choosing the rt.jar and otherwise launching the VM is 
handled by the IVMRunner.

Darin, can you comment the problem? Is there anything that PDE Launcher can do 
wrong in respect to choosing the IVMRunner to launch the workbench?

I have not been able to reproduce this error. I have seen a problem when a 
binary plug-in was compiled with 1.4 (unknowingly), and then failed to run with 
1.3. However, the test case does not indicate this.

In this case, since all plug-ins are binary, re-compiling is not an issue. I.e. 
if they were build with 1.3, then they remain as 1.3 even thought the workspace 
JRE is 1.4.

John, can you reproduce this with a "raw" F2/or later build?
Cannot reproduce this problem.  Please close.
